title: Use new versioning for API Security and create "Releases"
description:
### Problem

API Security uses a different versioning system then DAST and other teams. To give users a similar experience, move to a new system.

### Proposal

Versions will be "MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH"

- MAJOR: Incremented when changes are not backwards compatible. Whenever possible, avoid having to increment this number.
- MINOR: Feature changes. Increments for each published container image. Should include a changelog.
- PATCH: Patch for an existing MAJOR.MINOR release. (Perhaps this should stay build?)

This change will require re-thinking how we produce builds and include version numbers in components.

#### Option 1: Increment minor after a pub release

Existing build process intact, but change our version calculations so minor is incremented after each production release. For this to work we would make PATCH be BUILD #. So releases would never be `MAJOR.MINOR.0`, they would be more like:

1. `1.1.10`
1. `1.2.5`
1. `1.3.25`

In this example, each public release causing the minor version to increment. The final octet becomes the build number of the minor version.

#### Option 2: Increment minor when ready to publish

For this option we would need to re-think how we embed version numbers into releases. The current process embeds version numbers during the build process. Since we will not know the version number up front, another method is needed.

#### Changelogs

Each public release should include a changelog.

1. GitLab's changelog functionality. Investigate to see if this would be useful. https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/repositories.html#add-changelog-data-to-a-changelog-file

#### Publishing

When publishing a new container, a new "release" should be created with the changelog. The releases should be here:
https://gitlab.com/security-products/api-security/-/releases

You can see how its done here: 
https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/security-products/dast/-/releases

### Release Job

Links:
- [Release keyword ref](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/yaml/#release)
- [Update changelog](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/repositories.html#add-changelog-data-to-a-changelog-file)

Associate milestone with release:
- Requires API call or manual UX

Evidence:

- Artifacts are added to release evidence
- Reports are not added by default unless specifically collected as artifacts

Support release freeze by adding this rule:

```yaml
rules:
    - if: $CI_DEPLOY_FREEZE == null
```

title: Code Quality MR Diff report : Generate report based of comparison report
description:
### Summary

**The code quality MR diff report is showing incorrect data**.

In this [example MR](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/59226/diffs), we can see (not anymore as our ~"feature flag" has been disabled) several icons displayed on each files even though we don't see any **new degradation** introduced in our MR widget.

### What is happening?

After [pipeline completion](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/models/ci/pipeline.rb#L254), we create a new `codequality mr diff` report and persisting it as a `PipelineArtifact`. With our current implementation, we don't know **which lines introduced new degradation** as we don't have a base report to compare with.

### Proposal

The team has spoken and we will implement **option 2**.

#### ~~1. Generate report when creating diff to MR widget~~

Let's revisit our current approach by persisting our `PipelineArtifact` once we generate our comparison report at the merge request level which is used for our MR widget.

```mermaid
graph LR;
  GenerateCodequalityReportComparison-->FetchNewDegradationIntroduced
  FetchNewDegradationIntroduced-->PersistThemAsPipelineArtifact
  PersistThemAsPipelineArtifact-->DataIntegrityFixed
```

Here an example solution of how it could look like in ruby 👉 https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/59421


#### 2. Building diff after pipeline completion

The other option we have would be to generate our diff report on pipeline completion, keep it as it is today.

We could modify our [existing service](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/services/ci/pipeline_artifacts/create_code_quality_mr_diff_report_service.rb) and build our report within it. This allows us to keep our existing architecture and only refactor the way we [build our diff report](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/lib/gitlab/ci/reports/codequality_mr_diff.rb).

```diff
 module Ci
   module PipelineArtifacts
     class CreateCodeQualityMrDiffReportService
       def execute(pipeline)
         return unless pipeline.can_generate_codequality_reports?
         return if pipeline.has_codequality_mr_diff_report?

-        file = build_carrierwave_file(new_errors)
+        file = build_carrierwave_file!

         pipeline.pipeline_artifacts.create!(
           project_id: pipeline.project_id,
@@ -20,9 +20,22 @@ def execute(pipeline, new_errors)

       private

-      def build_carrierwave_file(new_errors)
+      attr_reader :pipeline
+
+      def merge_request
+        @merge_request ||= pipeline.merge_requests_as_head_pipeline.first
+      end
+
+      def build_comparer
+        head_report = pipeline.codequality_reports
+        base_report = merge_request.base_pipeline&.codequality_reports
+
+        Gitlab::Ci::Reports::CodequalityReportsComparer.new(base_report, head_report)
+      end
+
+      def build_carrierwave_file!
         CarrierWaveStringFile.new_file(
+          file_content: build_quality_mr_diff_report(build_comparer.new_errors),
           filename: Ci::PipelineArtifact::DEFAULT_FILE_NAMES.fetch(:code_quality_mr_diff),
           content_type: 'application/json'
         )
```

title: Improve performance of Repository Compare Branches/Tags API under load into next tier
description:
After adding in a new performance test for the [Branches Repository Compare API](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/api/repositories.html#compare-branches-tags-or-commits) it was found that endpoint is unperformant:

```
 █ Results summary
* Environment:                10k
* Environment Version:        13.11.0-pre `8b407f0a3fb`
* Option:                     60s_200rps
* Date:                       2021-04-20
* Run Time:                   1m 4.11s (Start: 16:49:59 UTC, End: 16:51:03 UTC)
* GPT Version:                v2.7.0
NAME                                        | RPS   | RPS RESULT        | TTFB AVG  | TTFB P90            | REQ STATUS     | RESULT         
--------------------------------------------|-------|-------------------|-----------|---------------------|----------------|----------------
api_v4_projects_repository_compare          | 200/s | 68.5/s (>48.00/s) | 2563.20ms | 3392.07ms (<5000ms) | 100.00% (>99%) | Passed


```

Looking at the environment metrics it appears that the endpoint is hitting the Gitaly and Praefect massively:
![api_v4_projects_repository_compare_branches_tags](/uploads/7a7fe5f45e7d9f4ba1c4cc7e30c24830/api_v4_projects_repository_compare_branches_tags.png)

The testing was done on our test [10k Reference Architecture](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/administration/reference_architectures/10k_users.html) environment as standard at 200 RPS with the project being tested a copy of [gitlabhq](https://github.com/gitlabhq/gitlabhq) (tarball can be found [here](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/quality/performance-data/-/blob/master/projects_export/gitlabhq_export_13.0.0.tar.gz)). For the repository comparison these branches are being used - https://staging.gitlab.com/gpt/large_projects/gitlabhq1/-/compare/12-2-stable...12-1-stable - diff size is 200 commits, `546 changed files with 8342 additions and 2856 deletions`.


### Steps to reproduce

1. Check out the [Performance Tool](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/quality/performance)
1. Run the specific test with the `run-k6` command.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

The results above show that the Branches/Tags Repository Compare API has a P90 of 5517.95ms.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

As per our [performance targets](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/quality/issue-triage/#severity) this endpoint is above the second tier target of 2000ms which is ~"severity::2" . Task is to improve the endpoint's performance into next tier.

title: [Feature flag] Rollout of `wiki_content_editor`
description:
<!-- Title suggestion: [Feature flag] Enable description of feature -->

## Feature

This feature uses the `:wiki_content_editor` feature flag!

<!-- Short description of what the feature is about and link to relevant other issues. -->
- https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/5643

## Owners / Stakeholders

- Team: ~"devops::create" ~"group::editor" 
- Most appropriate slack channel to reach out to: `#g_create_editor`
- Best individual to reach out to: @himkp @ealcantara 
- PM: @ericschurter 

## The Rollout Plan

<!-- Describe how the feature should be rolled out, and check the right boxes. You can check multiple if applicable -->

- [ ] Rollout for beta groups
- [ ] Rollout on GitLab.com for a certain period (how long?)


**Beta Groups/Projects:**

- `gitlab-org/gitlab` project
- `gitlab-org`/`gitlab-com` groups
- ...


## Expectations

### What are we expecting to happen?

<!-- Describe the expected outcome when rolling out this feature -->

### What might happen if this goes wrong?

<!-- Should the feature flag be turned off? Any MRs that need to be rolled back? Communication that needs to happen? What are some things you can think of that could go wrong - data loss or broken pages? -->

### What can we monitor to detect problems with this?

<!-- Which dashboards from https://dashboards.gitlab.net are most relevant? -->

## Rollout Timeline

<!-- Please check which steps are needed and remove those which don't apply -->

**Initial Rollout**

*Preparation Phase*
- [x] Enable on staging (`/chatops run feature set wiki_content_editor true --staging`)

- [x] Test on staging

- [x] Ensure that documentation has been updated ([More info](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/documentation/feature_flags.html#features-that-became-enabled-by-default))

- [x] Announce on the issue an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com

*Partial Rollout Phase*
- [x] Enable on GitLab.com for individual groups/projects listed above and verify behaviour (`/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab wiki_content_editor true`)

- [x] Verify behaviour (See Beta Groups) and add details with screenshots as a comment on this issue


**Global Availability** ([More Info](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#communicate-the-change))
*(Please Note that Beta,Alpha and General Availability (GA) are handled on a product level and not the feature-flag)*
<!-- The next checkboxes are probably only needed for high visibility and/or critical rollouts. Please refer to the official documentation linked above for more clarification -->

- [x] Coordinate a time to enable the flag with `#production` and `#g_delivery` on slack.

- [x] Announce on the issue an estimated time this will be enabled on GitLab.com

- [x] Make the feature flag enabled by default i.e. Change `default_enabled` to `true`

- [x] Enable on GitLab.com by running chatops command in `#production` (`/chatops run feature set wiki_content_editor true`)

- [x] Announce on the issue that the flag has been enabled

- [x] Cross post chatops slack command to `#support_gitlab-com` ([more guidance when this is necessary in the dev docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#where-to-run-commands)) and in your team channel


**Cleanup**

This is an __important__ phase, that should be either done in the next Milestone or as soon as possible. For the cleanup phase, please follow our documentation on how to  [clean up the feature flag](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/feature_flags/controls.html#cleaning-up).

<!-- The checklist here is to keep track of it's status for stakeholders -->
- [x] Announce on the issue that the flag has been enabled

- [x] Remove `:feature_name` feature flag
    - [x] Remove all references to the feature flag from the codebase
    - [x] Remove the YAML definitions for the feature from the repository
    - [x] Create a Changelog Entry

- [x] Clean up the feature flag from all environments by running this chatops command in `#production` channel `/chatops run feature delete wiki_content_editor`.

**Final Step**

- [x] Close this rollout issue for the feature flag after the feature flag is removed from the codebase.

## Rollback Steps

- [ ] This feature can be disabled by running the following Chatops command:

```
/chatops run feature set --project=gitlab-org/gitlab wiki_content_editor false
```

## Testing

Please run `package-and-qa` for regression purposes and to [make sure existing E2Es pass with the feature flag on](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/testing_guide/end_to_end/feature_flags.html#confirming-that-end-to-end-tests-pass-with-a-feature-flag-enabled).

epic.title: Create:Editor -- 13.11 - 14.0 -- Add Content Editor on Wiki Page

title: Code Quality MR widget: Status of report comparison is not taken into account
description:
### Summary The backend code quality comparison returns JSON data that includes a `status` property, but we are not taking it into account in **three cases**: :one: ~~The code quality MR widget reports "No changes to code quality" when the arrays of changed issues are empty, but the message is not accurate when the `status` is `failed`. The widget should instead use the "Failed to load code quality report" status/message in this case.~~ (on further investigation, `failed` refers to the status of the scan and not to the status of the report comparison, so we don't need to change the behavior in this case) :two: The code quality MR widget correctly reports "Base pipeline code quality artifact not found" when that is the case, but it is determined from the data source that we used before moving the comparison to the backend. We should instead show this message when the `status` is `not_found` so that we can remove the redundant code from the frontend. This could be combined with [moving the message into the body of the widget to make it more discoverable](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/293716) ![image](/uploads/ab7819ccc9507c18c02ff5dec38d06e5/image.png) :three: The code quality MR widget incorrectly reports "No changes to code quality" when the backend is still parsing and comparing the base and head reports (indicated by the HTTP status `204 No Content`). In this case we should display a loading icon and continue to poll until we get a response with a different HTTP status so we can display the results in the widget once they have been generated. ### Steps to reproduce For :one: 1. Run code quality on the base commit of an MR 1. Somehow cause an error when running code quality on the head commit of the MR 1. The JSON response should show a status of `failed` but the widget will say "No changes to code quality" For :two: 1. Run code quality on the head commit of an MR, but not the base commit 1. The JSON response should show a status of `not_found` and the widget will say "Failed to load codeclimate report" 1. The widget should have a question mark icon with a popover that says "Base pipeline code quality artifact not found" and links to the docs For :three: 1. Run code quality on the base commit and head commit of an MR with code quality changes 1. Once the job is done for the head commit, refresh the MR page until you can see the code quality widget 1. On the first load that you can see the widget, it should display "No changes to code quality" even though there are changes, and the network panel in your browser's dev tools should show a request for `codequality_reports.json` with a `204 No Content` response 1. Refresh the page again until the widget displays the real result ### Example Project ### What is the current *bug* behavior? The code quality MR widget reports "No changes to code quality" when the report comparison has failed/errored The code quality MR widget reports "No changes to code quality" when the reports are still being parsed/compared ### What is the expected *correct* behavior? The code quality MR widget should show "Failed to load code quality" (or some other more specific/helpful error message) when the report comparison has failed/errored The code quality MR widget should show a loading indicator while the reports are being parsed/compared, continue to poll for results until the endpoint returns a different result, then display the corresponding message for that result. ### Relevant logs and/or screenshots ### Output of checks #### Results of GitLab environment info
Expand for output related to GitLab environment info 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:env:info`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:env:info RAILS_ENV=production`)
#### Results of GitLab application Check
Expand for output related to the GitLab application check 

(For installations with omnibus-gitlab package run and paste the output of:
`sudo gitlab-rake gitlab:check SANITIZE=true`)

(For installations from source run and paste the output of:
`sudo -u git -H bundle exec rake gitlab:check RAILS_ENV=production SANITIZE=true`)

(we will only investigate if the tests are passing)
### Possible fixes

title: Pin CI templates to major version number
description:
### Problem

The existing API Fuzzing and DAST API CI templates pin versions to the minor version. This will be changing as we adopt a new versioning system in which the major number indicates a breaking change.

### Proposal

PIN the DAST API and API Fuzzing CI templates to the current major version `1`.

Tasks:

1. [x] Update API Fuzzing CI template and test
1. [x] Update DAST API CI template and test

title: Publish a major version number container
description:
### Problem

The versioning numbers for API Security are changing such that the MAJOR number indicates incompatibility and the minor is functionality change. Currently the API Security container is published only for the minor version and build version.

### Proposal

Publish a major version image as well. This will allow pinning a template to just the major version.

Tasks:

1. [x] Publish with a major version only tag in addition to existing tags
1. [x] Publish a container

title: VSA: Create and Delete options should remain visible in VS dropdown
description:
### Summary

When there are 10+ custom value streams already created in group VSA, the Create and Delete options get pushed to the bottom of the dropdown menu out of view. I need to scroll down in the dropdown to discover these options. If I don't scroll down, it isn't obvious to me that I can create or delete a value stream. 

![Screen_Shot_2021-04-14_at_9.53.31_AM](/uploads/d510a104e60de182ffd4c35d5af2e999/Screen_Shot_2021-04-14_at_9.53.31_AM.png)

### Proposal

Make the bottom section of the dropdown (the section containing the create and delete options) fixed so that these options are visible at all times

title: Add options arguments to Metric YAML defintion for filtering data in instrumentation class
description:
We could have an `extra` attribute to Usage Data metrics definitions.

In this attribute we can have informations necessary for collecting the data for Usage Ping

An example could be for data we collect from redis.

Metric definition for `i_code_review_mr_diffs_weekly` metric

```ruby
---
key_path: redis_hll_counters.code_review.i_code_review_mr_diffs_weekly
description: Count of unique merge requests per week with diffs viewed
product_section: dev
product_stage: create
product_group: group::code review
product_category: code_review
value_type: number
status: data_available
time_frame: 7d
data_source: redis_hll
instrumentation_class: Gitlab::Usage::Metrics::Instrumentations::UsersCreatingMergerequestsDiffs
distribution:
- ce
- ee
tier:
 - free
 - premium
 - ultimate
```

Instrumentation class

```ruby
module Gitlab
  module Usage
    module Metrics
      module Instrumentations
        class UsersCreatingMergerequestsDiffs < RedisHLLMetric
          event_names :i_code_review_mr_diffs
        end
      end
    end
  end
end
```

The event names could be set in the Metric defintion itself, and later used when collecting the data.
This way we will hove only one class to instrumment all redis hll metrics
```ruby
# i_code_review_mr_diffs_weekly.yml
...
options: 
 events: [i_code_review_mr_diffs]
```

```ruby
# base_metric.rb
module Gitlab
  module Usage
    module Metrics
      module Instrumentations
        class BaseMetric
          include Gitlab::Utils::UsageData
 
          attr_reader :time_constraints
          attr_reader :extra

          def initialize(time_constraints:, options: {})
            @time_constraints = time_constraints
            @options = options
          end


          class << self
            def value(&block)
              @metric_value = block
            end

            attr_reader :metric_value
          end

          def value
            alt_usage_data do
              self.class.metric_value.call
            end
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
end

# redis_hll_metric.rb

module Gitlab
  module Usage
    module Metrics
      module Instrumentations
        class RedisHLLMetric < BaseMetric
          def metric_events
            options[:events]
          end
          
          def value
            redis_usage_data do
              Gitlab::UsageDataCounters::HLLRedisCounter.unique_events(**redis_hll_time_constraints.merge(event_names: self.class.mentric_events))
            end
          end
        end
      end
    end
  end
end
```

Note: Untested code

title: Ensure that disabled API scan rules match ZAP weekly
description:
# Context

In `api_scan_exclude_rules.py`, DAST has a list of ZAP rules that are disabled for API scans. This list comes from the API scan policy file found in the ZAP image.

However, it looks like DAST's list has become out of date.

# Proposal

Run `docker run -ti --rm owasp/zap2docker-weekly cat /home/zap/.ZAP_D/policies/API-Minimal.policy` and ensure that all rules disabled in that policy are also in the list in `api_scan_exclude_rules.py`

**Note:** DAST may have more disabled rules than ZAP. Do not remove rules from `api_scan_exclude_rules.py` even if they are enabled in the ZAP policy

title: Max users count and license upload error contradiction
description:
<!---
Please read this!

Before opening a new issue, make sure to search for keywords in the issues
filtered by the "regression" or "bug" label:

- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=regression
- https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/issues?label_name%5B%5D=bug

and verify the issue you're about to submit isn't a duplicate.
--->

### Summary

- Customer receives an error when uploading renewal license: `During the year before this license started, this GitLab installation had 15 active users, exceeding this license's limit of 14 by 1 user. Please upload a license for at least 15 users`.
- [Version app](https://version.gitlab.com/hosts/1135247) and dashboard screenshot indicates max users never went over 14 during the license period 
- Customer upgraded from 13.5.2-ee to 13.9.2-ee during the license period. This upgrade [changed how max users were calculated](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/7008).
- Active users have gone up to 21, but max users have stayed the same, which indicates that the system is not including bots in the max count.
- We assume the system is looking for 1 trueup in the new license, however, there is no evidence of a trueup occurring or max users exceeding the `users in license` count for the previous license.

### Examples / Reported cases

1. [Ticket](https://gitlab.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/204933) | [Customer account](https://customers.gitlab.com/admin/customer/37010/edit) | [Licenses](https://license.gitlab.com/licenses?utf8=%E2%9C%93&search=%40provenexpert.com&commit=Search)
1. [Ticket](https://gitlab.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/212903) | [Customer account](https://customers.gitlab.com/admin/customer/10950/edit) | [Licenses](https://license.gitlab.com/licenses?search=informatique%40jurafiltration.fr)

title: Update default initial branch name in Frontend code (non-editor related specs)
description:
This issue is analogous to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/323925, only for Frontend code. ### Problem to solve As we work to [Rename `master` branch to `main` branch in the GitLab project](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/221164), Frontend code that references the old default initial branch name need to be updated (HAML files have already been covered by the Backend issue: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/323925). For example: ``` ./app/assets/javascripts/static_site_editor/constants.js:export const DEFAULT_TARGET_BRANCH = 'master'; ``` ### Proposal The word `master` is present in many places in the codebase. For 14.0 we are most interested in changing `master` to `main` only when it will break the application if `master` is returned, eg: `@project.default_branch || 'master'`. The full objective of https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/3600 is to completely remove the word `master` from the codebase including method names, constants and in test data. Work on this issue should produce: - MRs to remove `master` where it will break the application when there is no longer a `master` branch - a follow-up issue to remove all of the other references, which will be scheduled at some point after %"14.0" If it is just as easy to change the references as part of this issue, then go for it! :rocket: ## Initial scans #### ./spec files ``` grep -r title: [UX] Iterate on Active trial status - Promote high interest features during trial.
description: ## Problem We are currently sending weekly emails to advertise some features and having our sales team reaching out to users during the trial period. But so far nothing in app connects the user with the value they just unlocked. We may be able to do a more effective job at following up on trials and attempting to drive these trial users to convert promoting high interest features. #### What we know In an organization, the people signing up and starting the trial process are not always the ones involved in trying out GitLab and its various features. (Buyers personas v.s User personas). The internal users that could advocate for the product are not fully exposed to its value. ## Hypothesis In-app trial follow-ups are more likely to increase trial to paid conversion: * Actual users of the product would be the best advocate for its adoption. * In context feature discovery is more likely to prove product value and lead to an "a-ha" moment (v.s emails). To verify this we will display feature promotion in the trial status widget and measure the impact on trial to paid conversion. ## Input data * Trial to paid [baseline conversion rate](https://app.periscopedata.com/app/gitlab/761347/Group-Namespace-Conversion-Metrics?widget=10130784&udv=0). * Baseline Initial experiment results for trial widget(TBD). * Top 3 features company upgrade for Bronze (before EOA): * Merge approvals * Multiple approvers in code review * Code Review Analytics * Top 3 features company upgrade for Silver * Merge request reviews * Approval rules for code review * CI/CD Pipelines Dashboard * [Top 10 features](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/ux-research/-/issues/1012#note_550356621) that are of high interest for users. ## Potential solution Update the trial widget content to promote Dependency scanning in the first 7 days of the trial. We are not picking any features mentioned above as we would not be able to reach significance running an experiment (see [design thread for more](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/327682/designs/MR-approval-rule-prompt.png)). ### Design #### Flow ![feature-trial-status](/uploads/d229dc715831cd80991ab8879c7bb305/feature-trial-status.gif) #### [📐 Specs](https://www.figma.com/file/AGzUBIW7SwnYY5QGyNoRiU/Experiment-Add-active-trial-status?node-id=777%3A3648) ### Things to consider * Can we accurately measure the following: User exposed to the test adopted the promoted feature > Had a sustained usage of it > Upgraded to plan X. * If the Learn GitLab tab is rolled-out, there is a potential overlap. Is there a way we could combine both? Does this needs to be addressed in this issue?

epic.title: Follow up experiments for: Active Trial Status

title: Define possible Redis slots for events tracked using Redis HLL
description:
While doing the exercise to name this event, I realised that users could be a good choice for Redis slot. 

In case of Redis HLL counters we could come up with a couple of well defined redis slots. In fact it would only make sense to combine this data.

Possible Redis slots could be subjects we are counting on:

* `users` - For example for users_creating_epics
* `projects` - projects_removed
* `issues` - 


cc @gitlab-org/growth/product-intelligence/engineers

title: Update Usage Ping docs Redis HLL event names
description:
Having the [Metrics naming convention](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/development/usage_ping/metrics_dictionary.html#metric-name) in place we can use the same naming for Redis and Redis HLL events

Update Usage Ping guide events name examples with examples having the naming convention applied in order to give good examples for new events added

Example 

`i_search_total` -> `users_searching`

`g_project_management_epic_created` -> `users_creating_epics`

epic.title: Usage Ping Naming Convention MVC

title: Implement usage ping for group-level DevOps Adoption
description:
### Summary

In https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/5252 we added the DevOps Adoption feature at the group level. We should track usage of the group-level feature over time so we can measure adoption of this feature. 

### Proposal

Implement usage ping to track the number of ~~page views~~ unique visitors for the `analytics/devops_adoption` page, similar to how we track other Analytics pages. Usage event name should be `g_analytics_dev_ops_adoption`

epic.title: Group-level DevOps Adoption

title: Group/project members - migrate pagination to Vue
description:
## Summary

In preparation for https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/324681 we need to migrate the pagination which is currently rendered with HAML to `GlPagination`. The pagination needs to be inside of the Vue application before we can use `GlTabs`

## Improvements

Remove deprecated Bootstrap tabs in favor of `GlTabs`

## Risks

Minimal, this is a well tested section of the codebase

## Implementation plan

1. Pass pagination data to Vue application in [app/helpers/groups/group_members_helper.rb#L25](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/helpers/groups/group_members_helper.rb#L25) and [app/helpers/projects/project_members_helper.rb#L38](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/helpers/projects/project_members_helper.rb#L38)
1. Parse pagination data and store in Vuex store in [app/assets/javascripts/members/index.js#L8](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/members/index.js#L8)
1. Add `GlPagination` in [app/assets/javascripts/members/components/table/members_table.vue](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/members/components/table/members_table.vue)
1. Update specs in [spec/frontend/members/components/table/members_table_spec.js](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/blob/master/spec/frontend/members/components/table/members_table_spec.js)

epic.title: Migrate group/project member tabs to `GlTabs`

title: Geo Status Page 2.0 - UI Actions
description:
## Vision Based on proposal described here: https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/4712#implementation-proposal
Code to ultimately be replaced: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/tree/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/geo_nodes After the UI has been added we will want to ensure the actions are implemented. ## What is needed 1. New button -> Simple link to `/admin/geo/nodes/new` 2. Edit button -> Simple link to `/admin/geo/nodes/edit/$id` 3. Remove button -> GlModal popup that interacts like the current UI today.

epic.title: Geo: Implement the new design of the Geo node page

title: Geo Status Page 2.0 - Take over `geo_node` namespace
description:
## Vision Based on proposal described here: https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-org/-/epics/4712#implementation-proposal
Code to ultimately be replaced: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/tree/master/ee/app/assets/javascripts/geo_nodes This issue will be focused on renaming the `geo_nodes_beta` technical namespace to the expected `geo_nodes` techincal namespace. As of https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/296986 all the legacy Geo Node code should have been deleted from our codebase so this namespace should be open for a quick and easy rename. ## How Simply replacing all the `geo_nodes_beta` namespacing implemented as part of the above epic with the `geo_nodes` namespacing.

epic.title: Geo: Implement the new design of the Geo node page

title: Users not getting blocked despite block_auto_created_users when user cap is enabled
description:

When user cap is set, `omniauth_block_auto_created_users` is not blocking the new accounts if set to true.

title: Migrate “Status checks” to go under Settings > Merge Requests, after Merge checks.
description:
> This is the ~frontend implementation issue

Problem to solve
---
Merge Request (MR) Approval Rules are meant to map to specific users that can take action on approving Merge Requests. As a result, Status checks does not align with the intent of that feature so they will be relocated in the UI as another Merge Request setting.

Proposal
---
1. Remove status checks as an approval rule option.
1. Add `Status checks` after `Merge checks`, reusing the majority of the table/modal components from MR Approval Rules

Design
---
<details><summary>Screenshots</summary>

|:new: location|
|---|
|![Status_checks](/uploads/b6373405594efd08e22774df0ba89f25/Status_checks.png)|

| Modal - :x:  | Modal - :white_check_mark: |
| ------ | ------ |
| ![Modal_-__failure](/uploads/6de32be8e6c294c08e6fe9173c8068e4/Modal_-__failure.png) | ![Modal_-_valid](/uploads/fe9816eca7057e36947979ba7fcc1a15/Modal_-_valid.png) |



</details>

Is this a cross-stage feature?
---
:handshake: ~"group::compliance" ~"group::source code" ~"group::code review"

Implementation
---

I think this will be a weight of :five: due to the many changes needed:

1. Add a new application under merge checks
   - See if we can reuse code from `ee/app/assets/javascripts/approvals/components/project_settings/app.vue`
1. Add a store to CRUD the status checks
   - Reuse the store code from https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/300973
1. Add a list view for the status checks
   1. Using the `ApprovalGateIcon` (we can probably rename this)
   1. With a edit button
   1. With a delete button 
1. Add a `Add status check` button and open the create model when clicked
1. Add a create modal
   - Can reuse parts of `ee/app/assets/javascripts/approvals/components/modal_rule_create.vue`
   - Can reuse parts of the `RuleForm`
   - No need to use the approval type selection
1. Add a edit modal
   - Can reuse parts of `ee/app/assets/javascripts/approvals/components/modal_rule_create.vue`
1. Add a delete modal
   - Can reuse parts of `ee/app/assets/javascripts/approvals/components/modal_rule_remove.vue`

Moved to https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/332017:
1. Undo the changes made to approvals in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/300973
1. Update the feature specs and add new ones for status checks

Follow-up: Look at moving similar code to a shared usage between approval rules and status checks

title: Further improve Total Blocking Time performance metric of Merge Request Changes page with large amount of changes
description:
# Context

Following the recently shipped improvements that lowered the TBT metric, the battle isn't over. We'll continue to pursue better performance and this issue will track that effort.

Previously:
* https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/241841 %13.7 
* https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/295237 (spike) %13.10 
* https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/323616 %13.11 

# Proposal

The most recent report (10k reference architecture) is still showing a high TBT metric.

```
NAME                                  | FCP (ms) | LCP (ms)         | TBT (ms)         | SI (ms) | LVC (ms) | TFR SIZE (kb) | SCORE | RESULT
--------------------------------------|----------|------------------|------------------|---------|----------|---------------|-------|-------
web_project_merge_request_changes     | 623      | ✓ 3769 (<12500)  | ✓ 29231 (<47500) | 3645    | 8333     | 1332.7        | 65    | Passed
```

[As detailed in this comment](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/327635#note_579656991) the [target page for this test](https://staging.gitlab.com/gpt/large_projects/gitlabhq1/-/merge_requests/8785/diffs) was recently changed after a review with ~"group::code review". TBT was found to be notably higher than the previous target but since the new target is representative of the 99th percentile of MRs this is considered to be representative moving forward.

As per our [performance targets](https://about.gitlab.com/handbook/engineering/quality/issue-triage/#severity) the metric is above our main target of 300ms and falls under the ~"severity::1" tier. Task is to improve the action's performance to fall into the ~"severity::2" tier of <9000ms.

Despite the acknowledgement of this page being an exception given the nature of its content, the ~"group::code review" OKR for Q2 will be tied to this effort: https://gitlab.com/groups/gitlab-com/-/epics/1426 

Things to look into:

* Hiding the file tree https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/290281 
* Virtual scrolling https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/326773
* Memory improvements

# More details

* See this thread: https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/323616#note_550497219

title: Display Status checks as a non-blocking Merge Request Widget
description:
> This is a ~frontend implementation issue

Problem to solve
---
APIs that are listed as a status to check should appear within a Merge Request. This is non-blocking information that provides better context to the systems that tie to a change.

Proposal
---
Add `Status checks` after `Test summary` in the [MR Widget container](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/create-stage/-/issues/12830#note_536975738).

Design
---

For the first iteration, they ~backend will only return the status as `pending | approved`. Thus we won't be showing failure icons for now.

`Passed (Collapsed)`
![Passed__Expand_](/uploads/0943d49f83734d52c4af5bded26b2ccf/Passed__Expand_.png)

`Pending (Expanded)`
![Pending__Collapse_](/uploads/840efc75852dad3932d6ba18b805dbbf/Pending__Collapse_.png)



Is this a cross-stage feature?
---
:handshake: ~"group::compliance" ~"group::source code" ~"group::code review"

Licensing
---

~"GitLab Ultimate" 

Implementation
---

Estimate weight of :three: for the ~frontend, because while the component itself is relatively simple, it needs to be integrated into the merge request widget space which is quite complex.

1. Create a new status checks MR widget using the [`ReportSection`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/reports/components/report_section.vue#L161) component.
1. Fetch the status checks added in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/merge_requests/61300.
1. Create a status checks issue body using the [`SummaryRow`](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/blob/master/app/assets/javascripts/reports/components/summary_row.vue#L62) to display each status.
1. If any checks are still not completed, we should continue to poll and update the component once the checks have completed.
1. Add feature specs.

title: Remove env var FUZZAPI_CONFIG from e2e tests for API Fuzzing
description:
<!-- This template is a great use for issues that are feature::additions or technical tasks for larger issues.-->

### Problem

API Fuzzing is changing the default location of it's configuration file. The e2e tests have been updated to set the configuration file to the new location for testing. Once the CI template MR has been merged this will no longer be needed.
Additionally, `FUZZAPI_REPORT` has been removed from the latest template. e2e test will require to use `REPORT` (or hard coded file path) when using the report.

### Proposal 

Revert e2e tests to using the configuration value provided by the CI template.

1. [x] Remove configuration stage for e2e tests so the built-in config is used
1. [x] Add environmental variable REPORT, then replace `FUZZAPI_REPORT` with `REPORT` variable.

title: UpdateMergeRequestsWorker lock contention
description:
`UpdateMergeRequestsWorker` is experiencing a lot of lock contention 

Slowlog search: https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/goto/847ddc7a734c14c85f5ac2c915cd385a

This in turn is saturation pgbouncer: https://dashboards.gitlab.net/d/pgbouncer-main/pgbouncer-overview?orgId=1&from=1618306200000&to=1618327859999&var-PROMETHEUS_DS=Global&var-environment=gprd&var-sigma=2&viewPanel=1228921753

Which is leading to a `rails_sql` SLO violation: https://gitlab.slack.com/archives/C101F3796/p1618327652181400


### SQL Statement

Contention is occurring for

```sql
UPDATE "merge_requests" SET "merge_status" = $1 WHERE "merge_requests"."id" = $2
```

### Client Transactions 

One of the problems appears to be that `UpdateMergeRequestsWorker` relies on client transactions that are being held open and leading to the contention. 



(Placeholder - more details to follow)

title: Spike - Frontend : Use JSON Schema in the pipeline editor for auto-complete and auto-suggest
description:
This is a ~frontend spike issue based on the discussion https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/299190#note_550563107

Given the previous spike, ~backend should be able to auto-generate JSON schema. 

The spike should answer the following JTBD:

1. When writing a pipeline I would like to know what are the available keywords I can use.
   * Proposed solution - auto-complete of keywords in an accurate position (e.g. [Script](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/yaml/#script) could only come after double spacing)
   * Auto-suggested of valid values - e.g. when user writes `Stage:` we should suggest a list of available stages when a user writes `when:` we should auto-suggest (manual, always, delay, etc...)

1. When looking at a keyword i would like to know what this keyword is doing.
   * Tooltip when hovering over a keyword
   * link to the keyword documentation

We should not try to validate the user pipeline using the JSON schema if the users are typing a keyword that doesn't exist in the schema we should allow them to do so, the linter will provide our users with the notification that the schema is invalid.

One [idea](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/299190#note_539454723) which was raised during the previous spike is to reuse the logic that exists today in the web-ide and iterate on top of it

title: Simple index of the PyPI package registry is not compliant with PEP 503
description: ### Problem to solve [PEP 503](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0503/#specification) states that > A repository that implements the simple API is defined by its base URL, this is the top level URL that all additional URLs are below. The API is named the "simple" repository due to the fact that PyPI's base URL is `https://pypi.org/simple/`. > > [...] > > Within a repository, the root URL (`/` for this PEP which represents the base URL) MUST be a valid HTML5 page with a single anchor element per project in the repository. The text of the anchor tag MUST be the name of the project and the href attribute MUST link to the URL for that particular project. As an example: > > ```html > > > > frob > spamspamspam > > > ``` The root URL of a PyPI package registry on Gitlab shows ```sh $ curl https://__token__:@gitlab.netqa.de/api/v4/projects/127/packages/pypi/simple {"error":"404 Not Found"} ``` instead. ### Proposal Render the simple index page when accessing `packages/pypi/simple`. I guess an endpoint should be added to `lib/api/pypi_packages.rb`, from brief looking at the code, not a Ruby expert though.

epic.title: Key improvements for the PyPI repository

title: UpdateHighestRoleWorker generates very expensive SQL queries
description:
The `UpdateHighestRoleWorker` worker generates some very expensive SQL queries. 

The query below is taking up to 10s to complete. This query also takes place on the primary Postgres instance. 

```sql
SELECT MAX("members"."access_level") FROM "members" WHERE "members"."user_id" = $1 AND "members"."requested_at" IS NULL
```

Kibana search: https://log.gprd.gitlab.net/goto/63410f37c6d6cedfa509a3720936f260

cc @lmcandrew
